comment._content: See other LoC Flickr pictures with tag Percy Wendell See bottom of page at books.google.com/books?id=o4MAAAAAYAAJ&pg=PA487 for a summary of his Harvard career.

comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: A report on Harvard sports a little later than this has reports on football at books.google.com/books?id=YluWJIchpVEC&pg=PA76&lp... Of the footballers pictured in this batch of Bain photos, I see: H. R. Hitchcock, Jr. '14 W. H. Trumbull, Jr. '15 D. C. Parmenter '13 P. L. Wendell '13 R. T. P. Storer '14 F. J. O'Brien '14 G. A. McKinlock Jr. '16 For Coolidge there are two possibilities: T. J. Coolidge, 3rd '15 C. A. Coolidge '17

comment.author: 54904823@N00
comment._content: It looks like the 1913 team which was undefeated. Several graduated in 1913 so would not be here for 1914. One player pictured started in 1913 and would not have been here in 1912. The full names are: Percy Langdon Wendell (1889-1932) 1913 Derric Choate Parmenter (1890-1958) 1913 Robert Treat Paine Storer (1893-1963) 1914 George Alexander McKinlock, Jr. (1893-?) 1916 Walter Henry Trumbull, Jr. (1893-?) 1914 Harvey Rexford Hitchcock, Jr. (1893-?) 1914 I get the full names from their World War I draft registration. Their Wikipedia articles are: en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Robert_Treat_Paine_Storer en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Percy_Langdon_Wendell Here is a photo of the 1913 team: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/richard_arthur_norton/4168045191/] books.google.com/books?id=UlLvwa0dVXgC&pg=PA17&lp... parmenter&f=false

comment._content:
swanq and Richard Arthur Norton:
